definition: to receive a raise in salary
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid

sentences.english: Mr. Black, I have just been married, therefore can I get a raise in my wages?
sentences.chinese: 布萊克先生，我剛剛結婚了，所以我能提薪嗎？

sentences.english: Since then I have never said turkey about having a raise in my pay.
sentences.chinese: 從那時起我再也不談關於提薪的事了。

sentences.english: He seems to be in easy circumstances since he had his pay increase.
sentences.chinese: 自從他提薪後，他的日子似乎好過些了。

sentences.english: I waited until the boss was in good mood before I broached the subject of my raise.
sentences.chinese: 我直等到老闆心情好時纔開始提及我的提薪問題。

sentences.english: She's got a raise of thirty dollars a month.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了每月三美元的提薪。

sentences.english: But watch it, or you may undermine your chances for raises and promotions.
sentences.chinese: 但這也有可能使你的提薪或提升機會煙消雲散。

sentences.english: How would you justify a raise to your current supervisor?
sentences.chinese: 你如何評價對你當前主管的提薪？

sentences.english: What he really desires is a raise.
His tightfisted employer is unwilling to give him a raise.
sentences.chinese: 他吝嗇的老闆不願意給他提薪。

sentences.english: The wage increases agreed in January are to be backdated to October last year.
sentences.chinese: 元月答應的提薪將追溯到去年10月份起算。
